Uses of Dependency in rpc.model.util
 

Methods in rpc.model.util that return Dependency
 Dependency Dependency.reverse()
          Construct a new Dependency by reversing the from and to vertices and the underlying unit.
 

Methods in rpc.model.util that return types with arguments of type Dependency
 java.util.Map<VertexPair,java.util.Set<Dependency>> Model.getAllDependencies()
          Retrieve all the dependencies that the model holds.
 java.util.Set<Dependency> Model.getDependencies(VertexPair vp)
          Get all the dependencies that hold for a given pair of vertices.
 

Methods in rpc.model.util with parameters of type Dependency
 void Model.addDependence(VertexPair vp, Dependency dep)
          Adds a known dependency to the model.
 boolean Model.checkDependence(VertexPair vp, Dependency dep)
          Checks whether or not the model has the specified dependency for the given vertex pair.
 boolean Model.checkDirectedDependence(VertexPair vp, Dependency dep)
          Checks whether or not the model has the specified dependency for the given vertex pair and that the reverse dependency does not exist in the model.
 boolean Model.checkReverseDependence(VertexPair vp, Dependency dep)
          Checks whether or not the model stores the reverse of the specified dependency for the reverse of the given pair of vertices.
